title: Change the address on your driving licence

details.description: Change the address on your driving licence online
details.more_information:
You'll need to:

* have your driving licence (both parts if it’s a photocard licence)
* be a resident of Great Britain
* provide addresses of where you've lived for the last 3 years
* have a valid UK passport or other form of identity
* have your National Insurance number if known
* not be disqualified from driving 

^If you need to change your name at the same time, you’ll have to apply by post.^

If you're moving abroad, you can’t register your new address on your British driving licence. Contact the driving licence authority in your new country of residence.

%Driving licences issued from 19 January 2013 will look different, but your existing licence will still be valid.%
details.introduction: You can change the address on your driving licence online. Apply using your Government Gateway ID; if you don't have one or need to re-register, you'll get an ID as part of your application.
details.alternate_methods:
You can also change the address on your licence by post. The process is different if you have a photocard or paper driving licence.

###Photocard driving licence 

Complete the ‘changes’ section on your paper counterpart, sign and date it.

Then send both your photocard driving licence and the paper counterpart to:

$A

DVLA
Swansea  
SA99 1BN

$A

### Paper driving licence

Send the following to DVLA:

* [a completed D1 'application for a driving licence' form](http://www.dvla.gov.uk/onlineservices/order_forms.aspx?ext=dg "Get a D1 ‘application for a driving licence’ form"){:rel="external"}
* your driving licence
* original [documents confirming your identity](/driving-licence-application-identity-documents "documents confirming your identity")
* a passport photograph

details.description: Includes getting a driving licence, fees and tracking your application
